review.reviewBody:
Fox doesn't offer different cheek pad thicknesses for this Rampage. Apparently, Fox offers cheek pads for every other Rampage model EXCEPT their most expensive carbon Rampage helmet! How is that acceptable?! $600 helmet and no different size cheek pads? The Fox Airspace goggles do not fit this helmet either. Who designed this helmet, anyways?! If you wrap the goggle strap where it's supposed to go around the helmet, it pushes the goggles up and it doesn't make a good seal around your face. The only way it works is if you position it lower on the helmet but then it blocks the rear vents. There is also a gap between the helmet and the goggles in the center. It's due to the way the Airspace goggles are designed. And lastly, the issue with the size: I'm a size medium in every helmet brand. 57cm/22.5in. Every review and even Fox says that this helmet runs small and if you're in between, go bigger. The Medium helmet is a size 57-58cm. I figure since I'm on the smaller side, I'll be fine with the medium. It is snug, but the main issue are the check pads. I removed them and tried the helmet and the fit is snug but not uncomfortable. The cheek pads are too thick and make the fit worst. Again, its a $600 dollar helmet and Fox cant even size it correctly?
I'll be looking at the Fox Proframe to replace this one.
review.name: Fox Needs to Do Better

name: Rampage Pro Carbon Mips Helmet

description: Buy the Vittoria Martello G2.0 4C Trail 27.5in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Martello G2.0 4C Trail 27.5in Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vittoria Martello G2.0 4C Trail 27.5in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Martello G2.0 4C Trail 27.5in Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vittoria Martello G2.0 4C Trail 27.5in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is easier to instal than a Maxxis Double Down but is just as tough. Not sure why another reviewer had such trouble. The compound is a consistent with a Maxx Terra and holds up extremely well. I ditched my inserts because I feel confident even with low OSI.
review.name: Great Enduro Tire Easy Instal

review.reviewBody:
Nearly returned it, it was so difficult to get onto the bead. I installed my Maxxis tires with just a floor pump with no issues, but these I had to use an air compressor blow nozzle, remove the valve core, and strap around the circumference of the tire to get it to go on. The width is much closer to my 2.4 in the rear than my hardtail's 2.8s. The carcass looks pretty square on my 31mm rim. I wouldn't run it on anything wider.

Traction is fantastic, and has actual transition traction, unlike the DHR II that came off. It's grippy and predictable in every turn, and bites much better. The initial bite is so much sharper that the bike actually feels like the head angle is slightly steeper. The rolling resistance is pretty good, tied my Strava PR on an asphalt climb that I'm pretty sure I set on my hardtail. Felt good on the handful of rocks I've ridden, too.

If it has a weakness that I've encountered, it's greasy hardpack. The 2.8 Rekons on my hardtail do a better job, but not by a ton. Overall, great tire. Might get a second one for the rear.
review.name: Great traction, miserable installation

name: Martello G2.0 4C Trail 27.5in Tire

description: Buy the Eureka! Jade Canyon 6 Tent: 6-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Jade Canyon 6 Tent: 6-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Jade Canyon 6 Tent: 6-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got the tent set it up and then the winds jumped up to 25 to 30 MPH and the rains came for three days my wife said take it down but I said no and it weather the storm !
review.name: good and strong

review.reviewBody: This tent has a ton of room.  We use it for 2 adults with cots and have plenty of room for a weeks worth of gear.  It is easy to set up and take down and seems very well built.  I look forward to using it in Wyoming next summer.  This tent is meant for car camping as it is a little heavy.
Easy to put up by myself. I like the larger windows. I have used this tent a few times camping and its worked out great!Its made well.
review.name: Nice tent!

review.reviewBody:
Recently used this tent on a camping adventure after replacing a much cheaper (and less trustworthy) tent. Well of course just our luck it POURED multiple times while on the trip...

...But luckily we had purchased this tent. At the bare minimum I expect a tent to keep you dry when it rains and this one did that. I felt it was spacious, set up was easy, I actually appreciate the weight and construction, and the bag is actually a decent size for putting it away. Overall very happy with the buy.
review.name: Perfect Tent for Car Camping

review.reviewBody: Easy set up and take down even with the help of a 3 and 4 year old. Packs down to a manageable size and very sturdy in the wind
review.name: Family of four comfortably

review.reviewBody: Very spacious tent. Easy to set up, although it requires a little bit of strength to get the poles into the roof mechanism. I though the toggle loop windows on the inside would be annoying but they were fine, and actually better than zips since they won't get stuck. Does well in hot weather, we are using it here in Kenya where the weather is primarily hot. Can't comment on rain as of yet but it looks like it would hold up well. Packs down easy and is more compact than my old Core Equipment 6 person instant tent, whilst also being more spacious on the inside. Love the fact that you can stand upright right at the door, while taking shoe's on and off. Very comfortable tent to stay in.
review.name: Lovely warm weather tent

review.reviewBody: My wife and I did a 5 day camping trip over Memorial Day - we had cool nights, warm afternoons, lots of bugs and some rain. This tent nailed it for us. The cabinmax structure with the tall ceilings make this tent super roomy. The rain fly worked perfectly and held up to some decent winds and rain. The tent sets up easy and easily fits back in the bag once taken down. I really like that the instructions are waterproof and attached to the bag so they will never get lost. Cant wait to sleep many more nights in this thing!
review.name: Awesome tent

review.reviewBody: This is an easy tent to setup once you understand the color coding on the parts. Im sure actually reading the instructions would have helped.

I chose this tent because of its near-vertical walls and it aluminum upper poles (versus the fiberglass poles on other options). I am really happy with my choice. We've been using this tent for car camping with a family of four. It is strictly a car camping tent, but it is just about perfect for that use. It is a little more complicated to set up than a simple dome tent, but once you have done it a couple of times it's very easy. I has tons of standing room. It is roomy for the four of us on long/wide thermarests, but I would be cautious about having cots on the floor without something down on the floor to protect it.

We have not dealt with rain seeping through the sides of the windows in spite of the lack of zippers. In a hard driving sideways rain I could see this being a problem, but it would have to be pretty extraordinary conditions. That being said, the frame itself is pretty strong and when guyed out it seems like it could take a decent amount of weather. Keep in mind that it's a cabin tent, though, and it's not designed for high winds.

It's very well ventilated up top. This is a good thing in all but the coldest conditions. Condensation hasn't been an issue. I would prefer a different tent for late fall or winter in the rockies, but you'd need a different tent anyways to withstand snow loading.

All in all, a very nice tent. Well made, well sewn, good fabrics. I'm very pleased. The main downside is the lack of stake down points in the middle between corners, which would help immensely. Not enough to dock a star, however.
review.name: Great summer camping tent

review.reviewBody: This is my 4th Eureka purchase.  After 18 years only one is out of service.  Great products from a leader in the industry.  Their customer service is excellent.  The Jade Canyon X6 is very roomy, easy to set-up and take-down. Very happy to have it in my camping gear.
review.name: A Great Tent from a Leader in the Industry!

name: Jade Canyon 6 Tent: 6-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody:
I'm giving these boots 4 stars based only on my 11 years of enjoyment from my Garmont Prophets. But I saw these on sale in 27.5 which was an impossibility in itself, and imagined myself in a pair of Meidjos or pin tech AT bindings locking the heel down on occasion. "They finally did it!" I thought; "Full tech toe and heel in an NTN boot!" 

Imagine my disappointment when it arrived and it has no tech heel. Scott must be ducking liability or just doesn't want the headache in manufacturing.
review.name: Does not actually have a tech heel

name: Voodoo NTN Telemark Boot

review.reviewBody: Bought these to replace the Chockstone/2 pant for mountaineering trips. I love the fit, the small amount of elastic in the waist is just enough to snug up the fit. I wish they were lighter in color. Dark pants arn't great on glaciers, the sun beats down and brutilizes you. These will work for non-glaciated climbs. My biggest complaint is the right side drop in pocket. Its perfectly sized for an iPhone or other smart phone, but the snap closure is incredibly difficult to open with one hand. Its very secure, but could be easier to open.
review.name: Great pants, needs minor improvements

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite pants. Spring, summer, fall, winter, Ive worn these in every season. They will handle a lot.
review.name: My favorite

review.reviewBody: One of my favorite pants. I wore them trekking in Pakistan and they were a good fit and held up well to the dust and rocks of the area.
review.name: Comfortable for long days

review.reviewBody: These are some solid softshell pants. Having the belt loops as an option is a feature I really like. I'll likely be ordering another pair soon.
review.name: Solid Hiking/Climbing pants

review.reviewBody: Just received my order.  The fabric weight, pocket placement and design is optimum.  I like the mildly elastic waist with a drawstring to fine tune fit which I would say is slightly slim.  Blue color is subtle and attractive.  I rank these as the PERFECT PANT and likely will order more.
review.name: Well designed!

name: Chockstone Trail Pant - Men's

description: Buy the Thule Epos 3 online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Epos 3
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Epos 3 online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Love this rack overall.  Larger weight capacity, more convenient storing (foldable) and it has locks.  Three primary boxes checked!  I also like the accessories that are available, making this a very versatile rack!

Opportunities:  One issue is that it doesn't lock in the upright position when your bikes aren't loaded.  (I usually leave my rack on my hitch from spring to fall.  Not'ny more!)  Granted, this "minus" is minor because it's simple to hitch and unhitch.  I just assumed this would be a default feature on any hitch rack.

Another observation is a narrower zone per bike.  The distance tray-to-tray is on the EPOS is 9.5" vs 11.5" on my older T2 Pro XT.  We have 2 e-bikes, which are pretty big.  For this reason, we exchanged our EPOS for the EPOS 3.

Now I'm happy!
review.name: Upgraded from T2 Pro XT

review.reviewBody: i had older model before and loved it, that one is even better and compact design which helps you to save some space in garage, easy process to mount it, as well!
review.name: love it, quality and simplicity

review.reviewBody: The auto pin that can be opened while inserting or removing the rack from the receiver wouldn't stay open. So now we need two people to install/remove the rack. One to keep the auto pin open and the other to handle the receiver.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: Vraiment facile dutilisation. Leger et maniable .  Les roues de transport sont trs utiles.
review.name: Thule Epos

review.reviewBody: I bought it a month ago and It is very easy to mount and secure your bike on this bike rack.
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: Needed to update my rear hitch, bike rack to accommodate the mountain bikes. I am so happy with this product. Its easy to use secure easy to lock bikes on wish I bought it many years sooner although it didnt exist at the time its a three car Ive carried two bikes and a regular mountain bike, and worked like a charm highly recommend for regular bikes as well as bikes I have this on my Ford F150 pick up and I put a short extender on it. I know they dont recommend this but its working fine and allows me to put my tailgate down and up without using the tilt feature. The tilt feature is very easy to use, which is also an option.
review.name: Well designed

review.reviewBody: Bought a couple of months ago - used extensively since. No match for the simplicity of both attaching to car and loading bikes.
review.name: Worth every penny

review.reviewBody: If you have to remove your bike rack after every weekend, but you want a solid easy to use rack, this is the best one ever. The fact that it comes in a 3 bikes version will suit a lot of family like us.
review.name: Light and fun to use

review.reviewBody: Setup in driveway and it looks great and an easy setup indeed. We havent had the chance to use yet, but super easy to load bikes on and off. Looking forward to owning another great Thule product.
review.name: Thule Epos 3

review.reviewBody: Love this bike rack. Easy to install and use. Shipping was quick and not much assembly required. The fold over with the bikes is awesome as it allows you to access to back of the vehicle still.
review.name: Great bike rack!!!

name: Epos 3

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased these approach shoes, because my trail runners were not supportive enough. I love these shoes! Durable, water, resistant, supportive, and comfortable right out of the box.
review.name: Great approach shoes

review.reviewBody: These were my first pair of approach shoes. Bought them for via ferratas and easier multipitches this summer. They were so great! I could trust my feet way more than I thought I would be able to. 12/10 would recommend
review.name: Awesome shoes

review.reviewBody: I made it through one season of non stops hiking & scrambling at red rock canyon In Nevada.  This shoe has took it well- Ive changed the insoles only & they still have tread & have not torn. All other shoes Ive had out here either get cut on the rock or tear from the cactus.  Cool shoe -great approach shoe in hot weather.
review.name: Cool & didnt tear!

review.reviewBody: I own these in two sizes -one for short day hikes and one size up for long hikes and thru hikes. They are light, super sticky, and fit my long narrow (but not n width) feet perfectly. My only complaint is that I need a US W11 for thru-hiking and they are rarely in stock. I don't mind that the sticky soles mean that I need to replace them quickly because they work so well for me -even when carrying a heavier pack on a hike like the JMT. I will be extremely sad if these are ever discontinued and my local gear shop knows to hold any size 11 shoes they get in for me because they are as rare as hens teeth it seems. I've been lucky to get my hands on three pairs so far and my fingers are crossed that they will be in stock again since my summer adventures on granite have really worn down the tread on my current pair. The only time I had any issues with their durability was with the laces getting damaged easily on some rocks once -and those have also been out of stock for years it seems.
review.name: My go-to for all hikes

review.reviewBody: This shoe has amazing support, a nice roomy toe box and excellent sticky rubber! Great for scrambling easy mountain terrain, much better than my running shoes! I bought my normal size and they are perfect. I really like the fact that they are not too narrow in the toe box, that makes for a much more comfortable shoe especially on long mountain days! I highly recommend this shoe!
review.name: Awesome approach shoe

review.reviewBody: Shoe looks of good quality, however, has a high arch which rubs causing blisters
review.name: High Arch

review.reviewBody:
I'm a novice climber (mostly gym, still trying to climb outside more), so I didn't necessarily need approach shoes. But I just finished my 8 day Utah national parks trip and am so glad I talked myself into getting these. We walked more than 10 miles everyday on rock faces and boulders; these shoes helped me hike confidently and were very comfortable. We also ended up hiking in some slot canyons, which I wouldn't have wanted to do without these grippy shoes. I could basically walk vertically down rocks with so much grip. 

The sizing of these shoes might slightly be off. I got a 40.5 and wear a size 9 in my altra road running shoes, but an 8 in chacos. I probably could have ordered a 40.0 and been happy, but I didn't have many issues with a 40.5. There were only a few times when I thought maybe a half size smaller might have helped. Overall really love these shoes!
review.name: A must have for hiking on rocks

review.reviewBody: Ordered this off the bat after doing research ! Have not tried them but will def update this review ! Just wanted to leave the size here because it took me over 2 weeks to convince myself to get em. I was going to go off the reviews as people stated it was bigger than advertised. Let me tell you ... it?s true to size at least for me . So if you are looking for a size 8 women -39.5. I usually wear a 6.5 in men?s if that helps! I had told my bff about this shoes and she bought them before me! And I seen how great they are! They help and are comfy considering we hike over 6 miles. They stick very well to rocks and the colors are just so vibrant!! Must have shoe
review.name: Women size 8 =

review.reviewBody: These reviews said they run large and to order down a size.  I completely disagree and also so does Zappos - their site says size up!   Super disappointing because I love the shoes and i need hiking boots but now it is 4th of July weekend and I can?t get a pair in time so I?m stuck with nike running shoes with zero traction.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: I wore my old Expeditions to the bone and was excited to upgrade.  LaSpo did not disappoint! The sticky dot rubber is incredible, even on polished slabs.  They are light enough to carry on a harness and breathable so they dont get stinky.  They have a stabilizing sole to prevent rolling (I'm accident prone!) and fly details that look like back to the future...
review.name: Comfy, sticky, and stable!

name: TX3 Approach Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have these for 2 weeks and they are awesome.  Warm, easy to walk in and very comfortable. Definitely worth it!!
review.name: Great slippers!!

review.reviewBody: These slippers are really warm and have a nice sturdy bottom. Only giving them 4 stars because my heel does slip around a bit when I walk in them, but I still would recommend buying them for wearing around the house - it truly doesnt bother me enough not to recommend them.
review.name: Toasty warm

review.reviewBody: Got these for hanging around the office while pretending I'm outside exploring, chilling at camp when out backpacking, and staying cozy in all other scenarios. These booties are super light but have good bottoms on them (feel sturdy still). They're also very warm which I love. The only thing not ideal is that they feel big for me even though I checked the sizing and should have the right size for my foot size. My heel slips around a bit due to this, would rate 5 stars otherwise if they fit better!
review.name: Cozy cozy

review.reviewBody: Beautiful colour, incredibly comfortable! I can't wait to use them on my camping trips.
review.name: More comfortable than The North Face slippers

review.reviewBody: They are warm and have a solid sole. The only downfall is because of the weight, they slip down a little when you walk, not completely off the heel though.
review.name: Pretty good bootie

review.reviewBody: These little booties are awesome. Are they the most attractive? No. But they are perfect for taking the trash out on a snowy day, keeping my feet warm until the fireplace warms up, or any apres ski activities.
review.name: Wear these everyday

review.reviewBody: These slippers are great! I love the upgraded sole because you cna now truly wear them indoors and outdoors in any weather, which lets face it, is what outdoor gear is all about. Great job OR I will be continuing to make great purchases with you and upgrade my arsenal. Thanks!
review.name: Love the upgraded sole on these!

review.reviewBody: Love these slip on booties. Perfect for winter! They are super comfortable and light.
review.name: LOVE

name: Tundra Trax Slip-On Booties - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Regenerative Organic Certified Cotton Stand Up Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been a fan of the 7" Stand Up Shorts for over a decade.  I am not a climber; I wear them for walking around and love the 5 pockets, and the general sturdiness of the shorts.  They are bullet proof.  I take every opportunity to buy a new pair when Patagonia releases a new colour (which I appreciate is against the company's ethos).  My only gripes are as follows.  Year over year I never know what I will get in terms of sizing as some years the 35" waist is loose, tight, or just right (having nothing to do with my weight!).  Gladly, the 2023 version is just right.  Finally, I am not a fan of the bigger stitched logo on the back.  The smaller classic version of the logo was perfect.  This new one feels childish and cartoonish.
review.name: Still Great Shorts

review.itemreviewed: Regenerative Organic Certified Cotton Stand Up Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Real stand-up shorts have double-seat back pockets, in some cases with an extra wallet pocket on the right side. The early models were 5" legs, not 7". 7" legs are for standing around and trying to look cool; 5" legs are less restrictive and are made for bookin'.
Wake up, Patagonia!
review.name: Bogus Reissue

name: Regenerative Organic Certified Cotton Stand Up Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: Just bought my third pair of these, so comfortable, waterproof and versatile!
review.name: My favorite hiking shoes!

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair. The first pair are still going strong but wanted a second pair just in case. They are sturdy and strong with a vibram sole. Best hiking boot I have owned that is not ankle high.
review.name: These hiking boots are the best

review.reviewBody: I normally wear a 9.5W, so I purchased 41. It felt great width-wise, but it was way too long. I then tried the 40.5 as well, but the width was so narrow that even after loosening the laces, just sitting in them for 20 minutes had my feet aching. Otherwise they felt rugged, sturdy, and not too heavy.
review.name: Good shoe, bad fit for wide feet

review.reviewBody: I thoroughly read reviews on these Spire GTX Hiking Shoe before prucahsing.  I already love my La Sportiva hiking boots I got last year.  Those are a 39.5 (Size 8).  I ordered a 39.5 in these.  They are LEAST 2 sizes too large.  They feel pretty stiff and a little bit heavy.  However, my boots were like that too and they are best boots I have ever owned.  These will be going back.  Not happy at all with the return charge from Backcountry either.  Not sure I will be ordering a smaller size with this return policy either, or anything else for that matter, as sizing is WAY off.
review.name: Run very large - Beware.

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like these shoes for hiking, but after three tries I'm moving on. First attempt was wrong size. The euro size I usually use in Birkenstocks was too small. Returned those and checked the size chart to get the correct size. I usually wear 8.5 and these felt true to size to me. On the 2nd attempt, the inside of the toes became sopping wet after about 10 minutes of walking around in wet grass with my dog. Surprising, as trail gear reviews of this shoe had touted their waterproofness after standing in a stream for 5 minutes. Backcountry customer service was kind enough to send a replacement pair to assess whether it was a one-time issue. Alas, the replacement pair had the same issue - sopping wet inside both toes after a short walk in mowed wet grass. Double checked that this wasn't due to moisture coming in through my socks-  nope. Continuing on the walk on a gravel carriage trail, I twisted my ankle twice and skinned the other knee as a result of the soles and heels of these shoes being so thick. These shoes are super steady feeling if you are walking on flat ground, but the shoe being built up so much means that any ankle twist is more dramatic than usual if you catch a rut, rock, or root the wrong way. On the pro side, the shoes are attractive and look well constructed; they are wide enough to be comfortable at the forefoot. I appreciate the bomber vibram sole for hiking with a stiffer shank for support and a cushioned feel with each step.
review.name: not waterproof; twisted ankles

review.reviewBody:
I looked for a long time for a shoe with good grip, lighter than boots, stiffer soles, that looked good for the summer. This one seemed to fit the bill. The grip is good (equivalent to Merrel Moab), the sole is strong (not as flexible) to endure very rocky terrain, and it looks slim, and less bulky and ugly than other hiking shoes. After wearing it, am I still 100% convinced? No. Somewhat, the heal of the shoe, like many other reviewers said, is very wide and as I hike my feet feels unstable, too loose inside the shoe. Tying the laces over and over to keep it snug is a must. Also, little pebbles get in due to the wide back, nothing gaiters can't take care of.

The harder sole protects the feet, but the insole seems to be bowed/curved, and my feet would get pretty tired towards the end of the day. I have another La Sportiva (Nucleo High II GTX) boot that I love, and unfortunately this one does not compare to that one. 

This review is based on the use over a week-long hike. I'm a size 8US, and both a 39 1/2. It fits fine.
review.name: Yet to be seen

review.reviewBody: This shoe is way more a hiking shoe than a running shoe. The sole is heavy and very stiff. The toes are a little narrow and it is a half size long. There is no arch support but there is room to change out the insole.  It seems well made and should live up to the great reviews as a hiking shoe.
review.name: hiking shoe

review.reviewBody:
They are well made and strong. 
Soles are Vibram. 
I am going to order a second pair just in case they get discontinued. 
Sizing. I take an 8.5 to a 9.0. 
I ordered a 40 they fit perfect. 
Great on the trails my ankles feel secure.
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody:
Spent the last 2 weeks in these incredibly reliable, super lightweight, yet durable hikers. We encountered snow, mud, rain, and every type of terrain while hiking National Parks. Great looking, comfortable, and kept my feet dry. Could not be happier. Purchased for my
Daughters as well and we are all thrilled with this shoe. Highly recommend.
review.name: Perfect for All Terrain

review.reviewBody: These shoes are great. I found it runs pretty true to size for me. I like how comfortable it is right out of the box and there is plenty of room for your foot and toes for ascent and descent. I would highly recommend these, they also look very stylish which is a big plus too!
review.name: Great Shoe!

name: Spire GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love the 4-way stretch of these pants. I can bend and move in any way I want without feeling restricted. They are breathable and dry quickly, and also block the wind. There are five enormous pockets, two with zippers, and I can carry a sizable EDC kit with plenty of room to spare. I have an outdoor job and I will never wear any other pant. I have tried soooo many other brands and styles and none stand up to this pant. They are perfect, for real.
review.name: Perfection in a pant

review.reviewBody: Bought these for hiking based on all the positive reviews and they are working out great! They are lightweight and comfortable. I am 5'8 and weigh about 200lbs and am wearing the size 16. I originally bought an 18, but they too big. I recommend these pants.
review.name: Great Pants

review.reviewBody: The pants are light weight for summer. They fit well. I like the fact I can cinch up the bottom of the legs for a different look. I have not had them too long, but they seem to be sturdy and long lasting.
review.name: Nice and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I have been searching for tall plus sized outdoor pats for a long time and I'm so happy to finally have a good pair. They are comfortable over all and I appreciate the small details like the draw string at the bottom. My only complaint is the unforgiving waistband. I have a pair of ferrosi plus size shorts too which I love but they have some stretch in the waistband which makes them a bit more comfortable. The waist band in these pants seems to have no give at all. It's not enough to be a problem for me, they still fit well and I would buy a second pair but that one change would make them the perfect pants for me.
review.name: Very pleased with one minor issue

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of Ferrosi pants that I've purchased. I love the comfort and fit. As a short, curvy outdoor professional, these are my favorite pair of synthetic work pants I've owned.
review.name: Comfy and hardy

review.reviewBody: Twice I ordered pants that were reported in stock. Both times, I added a pair of gloves to get the free shipping. Both times within 24 hours, the pants were cancelled but the gloves still shipped. I have no pants and I have too many gloves now, but it feels icky. It's hard enough finding quality women's plus technical outdoor clothing, but to feel exploited as well, I probably won't be ordering from OR again. Very, very disappointed by a brand I had tons of respect for.
review.name: Was looking forward to my new pants

review.reviewBody: These were a Christmas gift for my daughter-in-law. She mentioned to me she had tried them out walking last week with some fleece long johns and "they are THE BEST", and were a fabulous gift.
review.name: Would buy them again!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] There is a reason these pants are rated so highly. I'm big, perfect technical pants haven't previously existed in my size, and they are the best fitting, most comfortable, easy-to-move-in zippered-pocket (and deep pocket) pants I've ever owned. I will be buying more of these.
review.name: best pants I've ever owned

review.reviewBody: I bought these for our Inca trail hike and wore them 3 out of 4 days. The last day, it was pouring rain and I slipped on the trail. You can't even tell that I ate **** on the side of a mountain. Great pants!
review.name: Survived 4 days on the Inca Trail

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I work outdoors and these pants are comfortable and perfectly stretchy, without looking frumpy by the end of a hot day. I love wearing them all day from hiking around the river to sitting at the office. Absolutely recommend.
review.name: Very comfortable

name: Ferrosi Plus Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the helmet because I liked the look and the unique safety features and the cost was reasonable. On, the helmet is a bit narrower and taller than Bell and Giro helmets I've owned. I personally like the look. Ventilation seems reasonable. However, the large front vents do not hold sunglasses securely.

The fit is different than any other helmet I've owned. It is very narrow in circumference. I'm toward the upper end of the S/M size (57 cm) and it's noticeably snug from ear to ear. Once on, it is a comfortable fit as it hug the head well and stays in place nicely. With a cycling cap on the fit is a bit less comfortable because the narrow shape doesn't allow the helmet to sit down against the head as well. Definitely for those with more oval head shapes.

The straps and fit system leave the most room for improvement. There is almost no adjustability. The rear dial moves up and down freely, which acts similar to the adjustability of other helmet brands, but it's only floating and not a true adjustment. The portion of the straps in front of the ear are set really wide, coming out from the edge of the helmet instead of from the inside of the helmet. This makes it hard to get the straps to sit flush in front of the ear. Sunglasses need to go inside the straps because of the space left between the straps and head. Maybe there's a safety element behind the placement decision, but it feels more like a design flaw. 

When riding, these issues become less noticeable with some on-the-bike adjustments. And at the price point, it's a nice looking and well finished helmet. I believe Kali is newer to the cycling industry with their start being motorsports. The bike-specific brands seem to have refined fit and features to a much higher degree and trickled down much of that knowledge to their mid-level helmets. Kali could learn from those with more cycling helmet experience.
review.name: Good start but needs some refinement...

name: Uno Bike Helmet

This has such potential to be a great product except it does not stop shedding. I figured other reviews hadnt laundered the item therefore they were experiencing shedding. I have washed this pullover multiple times and there is still fuzz is EVERYWHERE.  Like other reviews mention it seems like micro plastic. 

Disappointed in this item for sure!

review.reviewBody: I originally ordered a medium in the Oatmeal Heather and absolutely love the fit and look of it! I will say I ended up returning it and ordering a size up due to how the stitching is under the arms. When I raised my arms out straight the sleeves pulled back from my wrists which bothered me. They still do in the large but not as much and the sleeves are looser so when I lower my arms they fall back without me having to pull them down. If you are looking for a more comfortable lounge around the fire or at home type of wear then I'd definitely recommend ordering a size up. Otherwise I love it!
review.name: Size Up

hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot 96 Active Anorak - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A little tight around the waist fit well every where else! Love the green color
review.name: On our way to Alaska

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am getting so much use out of this anorak!  It's lightweight enough to function as a light jacket or windbreaker, you can easily wear layers under for additional warmth if needed, and it's great as a light rain jacket (while not feeling as crinkly as a traditional rain jacket). I haven't worn the anorak in heavy rain, so I can't speak to how dry you'd stay in those conditions, but I have worn it in light showers and have been quite pleased with how to water just rolls right off it. The sleeves have elastic at the cuffs, which is nice for those of use with shorter arms (it's not tight, but does keep the sleeves from just falling over your hands); and the hood has a small bill, which gives you a little extra face protection.  This is now my go-to packable, versatile jacket.
review.name: Great and versatile - love it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is definitely my most frequent wear jacket of this year!Windbreak for sure!
review.name: Favorite jacket!

review.reviewBody: Another great Marmot item! Perfect fit and weight!
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The rain jacket was very nice and comfortable. Did i mentiom its also comfortable for rainy weather........
review.name: nice rain jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great lightweight windbreaker for days hikes. Easy to get in and out of even though the fabric isnt stretchy. Bill on the hood blocks out lots of raindrops.
review.name: Great for Day Hikes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for my wife and she loves it, the Anorak is now her go to jacket for crisp/wet days.  I think it looks cool and the colors work well together.
review.name: nice jacket.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice jacket, nice weight, seems well made. A little bit bigger than I wanted. Marmot sizing is a bit difficult. Normally size up to wear over sweatshirt, etc so I ordered an XL but easily couldve worn a L. Very loose fitting.
review.name: Nice enough

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This pullover is perfect for outdoor activities.  It is lightweight and very stylish. I have had many compliments.
review.name: Stylish outdoor wear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great Jacket. Perfect for winter and windy weather. The hood design is exceptional
review.name: Design is great and exceptional

review.itemreviewed: Saentis Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Function: I did not do my DD, so unfortunately 1/2 too big. I used them for about a year only at work (REI). Stayed in my locker so only saw glossed over concrete use.
Quality: For the environment being used in, held up. Occasional bumps on walls / fixtures was not enough to tear through material. Minor abrasions and scuff marks. 
Price: For the price, not as big of a regrettable purchase due to size issue. But, could see them being used as a go to for day hikes.
review.name: Runs 1/2 size larger than advertised

review.itemreviewed: Saentis Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Mine are not waterproof. They fit long and feel a bit awkward, thats unusual because am an 8.5 in nearly every other brand.  I figured a could live with them a little big and wore them on a rainy day trip. My feet weren't totally soaked but they were wet from the arch of my foot to the toes. Dissapointing.
review.name: Underachieved

review.itemreviewed: Saentis Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The waterproofability was the first to go, then all the seams, only took about 4months, not impressed, fit large, ordered a size down.
review.name: Okay but didn't last

review.itemreviewed: Saentis Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These replaced Solomon GTX Low hikers (I've gone through 4 pairs of Solomons in the past two years due to premature wear).  These are much more durable with similar same support and tread grip as the Solomons.  I wouldn't suggest that the best use for these are trail running - I'd personally look at other options that are more running oriented, while these are a bit more hiking focused.  I've found they're great for bagging peaks, 2-3 day backpacking trips, and just kicking around town..
review.name: Nice Kicks

review.itemreviewed: Saentis Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wear the shoes for work as I am a Beach Patrol Officer. These shoes are comfortable, keep out the sand and I really like the rubber on the sides. Solid and sturdy, perfect for what I am using them for.
review.name: Nice shoe

review.itemreviewed: Saentis Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This shoe is sturdy, durable, lightweight and has great traction. I use it for hiking, trail running, and climbing approaches.

name: Saentis Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Wild Country Session Screw Gate online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Session Screw Gate
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wild Country Session Screw Gate online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Sturdy general purpose D ring

These things are super lightweight and the gates screw easily. I've used them a bunch for setting up top rope anchors on sport routes so my less experienced peeps can climb too. No issues so far. The only thing I don't like is that they FEEL lightweight, almost too lightweight, purely a psychological thing, but sometimes that can make all the difference. For that reason alone I gave them 4/5 instead of 5/5.
review.name: I use them for anchors.

review.reviewBody: Works great. No issues through multiple climbs.

These carabiners are perfect for keeping gear or building anchors. I used them during a week long high angle rescue training and they were great for securing anchors and holding my gear on my harness as I climbed. The action of the screw gate was easy to use and the gate functions as it should. These are small carabiners FYI and could not be used for belaying or multiple anchor points. They function as they should and are a great additions to any climbers gear bag.
review.name: Good Carabiner

name: Session Screw Gate

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice lightweight shirt, fits me well in size S. Just got it so durability is unknown, but for the sale price its a great deal
review.name: Nice light shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shirt keeps me cool in the desert weather and the style matches well with jeans, slacks or shorts
review.name: Cool waves

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable, runs a size or little less small. Was a great replacement to my previous brand. Only thing that would make this better is a chest pocket.
review.name: Solid Choice

review.reviewBody: The previous version of this shirt is by far my favorite button up in my wardrobe. The new one has the same name but is nothing remotely close to the last one. The previous versions AirExchange material had micro holes for excellent breathability and a mechanical stretch. The new one is made of a much cheaper feeling rip stop nylon that doesnt breath well and has zero stretch. I get the feeling Marmot tried to cut cost by using leftover material from another product. Im hoping a future version of the Aerobora shirt goes back to the original AirExchange cloth.
review.name: New version leaves a lot to desire
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.

We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. Were available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had the previous version of this shirt and loved it so much I bought it again. However, the new version is different from the previous in many ways. The color, fabric type/texture, and where the tags/logos are all different. It doesnt feel as nice when wearing as the previous version. Fit is very similar. Only time will tell if the breathability, stretch and durability of the fabric will hold up like the previous one.
review.name: Nice shirt, not as nice as previous version

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight and an outstanding design.  Super versatile.
review.name: Chicks Dig It (at least mine does)

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought another because fit feels so good, and doesnt wrinkle.
review.name: More Marmot shirts.

name: Aerobora Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: I am 53 and 115 pounds and I bought the xs Down pants. These are not the most flattering pants in the world due to the puffiness. But I still absolutely love them. They are light as a feather and so cosy. Ive been wearing them at night and when an occasional neighbor sees them, I get huge compliments. They would be terrific on a backpacking trip and I will pack them for our next ski trip coming soon.
review.name: Comfy Down pants

review.reviewBody:
Ive been looking for a down layer to wear as a mid-layer on really cold ski days and this did the trick. The length is shorter but it works well for me as I can easily pull them up to my upper calf, without too much bunching, to accommodate my ski boots. They stay in place all day, as well, without riding up. 

The sizing is a little off. I originally ordered the small and it was too big in the waist and legs for the snug and comfortable fit I was looking for. I exchanged for the extra-small and am happy with how they work. 

I am happy with the and am looking forward to wearing them all season.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: After reading other reviews, I decided to purchase both the women's and men's versions in similar sizes. The men's version fits better and includes a drawstring at the bottom of the pant leg. However, the women's version has a strange fit and lacks the bottom drawstring. Not sure why this design choice was made, but it seems poor.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: My partner has the mens version, and the men's small fits me way better than the women's version. They both have the stretchy material on the inseam and bottom, zipper pockets and a good waist drawstring, but the mens small fit my build better. I am 5' 7" and 120 lbs, my waist is usually a size 0/2 or 25/26. The waist on this was slightly too big, and the legs were a little tight. I have a small waist and a larger hip. The women's version was also shorter, which didn't work well for me. Main complaint is that the women's does NOT have the draw string at the bottom of the pant leg like the mens, so the pants sit with a weird flare at the bottom, where as with the mens you can tailor the drawstring to your leg size. Happy that these pants have 800 fill down all the way around, besides the crotch and bottom of legs, makes it stretchy enough to move in. Almost good enough, but I returned and got the Mens small which fits perfect.
review.name: Almost

review.reviewBody: Bought these on a whim after seeing the men's version in the BC store. Had buyers remorse and figured I'd just return them because who needs a $200 pair of down pants?? Turns out, I do! I'm going to be living in these this winter. They are fantastic for cold early morning dog walks. I tried on the synthetic version and they felt like I had a trash bag on. These are soft and quiet. I'm 5'0 105lbs and the XS is loose and perfect length.
review.name: Love!

name: Waas ALLIED Down Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Nathan VaporAiress 3.0 7L Hydration Pack - Women's online or shop all Run from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: VaporAiress 3.0 7L Hydration Pack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nathan VaporAiress 3.0 7L Hydration Pack - Women's online or shop all Run from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is just an ok pack. Having a pack that is size XXS-M is just too broad of a range. Even with all of the straps adjusted tight, the pack still doesnt sit right on my smaller frame. I also feel like one side sits up higher than the other no matter what which is disappointing. The pockets are roomy but I wish the two up top that are meant for smaller flasks had a better closure than just VelcroI do like the waterproof pocket I can easily fit my phone in.
review.name: Had potential

review.reviewBody: Love this hydration pack for running and hiking. I can adjust the straps to get a good snug fit. The pockets are various sizes to accommodate all that I carry for the various distances and weather. The bladder is easy to fill and put in the back. I like the color too!
review.name: Fits well and carries what I need.

review.reviewBody:
So Im training for a half, that I have no desire to accomplish. Like I just like to run, I like the structure of a plan but no racing. This means Im running a lot. I live in Florida. It is summer and its humid as it rains daily. Did some research and didnt see any reviews for this particular vest but Nathan had great reviews. Its perfect for me. I got the xs-m and it feels good, no chafing or weird squeezing. Holds my gels and chews and glasses and phone with room to spare. Cut down hose to customize it for myself so it wasnt dangling. Theres a YouTube video on Nathans channel. All in all I love my vest and I dont run without it.

Pro tip: flip it upside down and suck the air out to prevent that annoying sloshing in the water bladder while running.
review.name: Baby runners first vest

review.reviewBody: The VaporAiress 3.0 is awesome! The sizing is perfect and it is very simple to use. I wear it while mountain biking and while running. No water sloshing around. No leaks. Easy to use while on the go. Just perfect!
review.name: Totally love it!

review.reviewBody: Used this new purchase for my first half marathon this past weekend. Ended the race well hydrated and never noticed this lightweight pack. Lots of pockets for gel, AirPods and other stuff. I am a new Nathan convert! Love it
review.name: Awesome new design

review.reviewBody:
Very comfortable, but the biggest bummer is that the front pockets don't work for bottles. I'd rather use bottles than bladder so I can better manage my liquid calorie intake.  Had I known the bottle pockets were so much smaller than the previous packs, I never would have purchased this one.  

Overall comfort is amazing. Nathan has nailed that. All their packs are so comfy.  

The hiking poles loops are quite small and my elbows bump it as I run so that's not super awesome. That's one thing Nathan packs haven't nailed, pole carrying.

Great product, comfortable, just a few annoyances which will prevent me from buying this style again.
review.name: Front pockets too small for bottles :(

review.reviewBody: It is very comfortable.  No jiggling of the water & roomy pockets.  The water pouch leaked on my first outing, but a new pouch was sent within days. It was very comfortable during a recent half marathon & will work perfectly fo my upcoming full.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: The vest is comfortable, the pockets are great and the bladder holds a good amount. I love the design and thoughtful details like the magnetic latch for the straw.
review.name: Great Features

review.reviewBody: So much room for everything I could possibly need. I absolutely love it
review.name: Need a vest for an ultra? Look no further

review.reviewBody: The velcro is very cheap and the first time I used it to open the pocket it tore. The front pocket bungee is also broken. I'm glad I didn't pay full price for this!
review.name: Kinda cheap... only buy if it's deeply on sale

name: VaporAiress 3.0 7L Hydration Pack - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Bahia 2/1 Front-Zip Long-Sleeve Surf Suit - Women's
review.reviewBody: So easy to get on, love the color and the fit. I got a size 6 (106 lbs, 25 waist, 32 hips, 54) and it fits perfectly. Theres a little excess fabric under the arms for me but other than that everything is good. Excited to wear this out into the ocean for surfing.
review.name: Love the fit

review.itemreviewed: Bahia 2/1 Front-Zip Long-Sleeve Surf Suit - Women's
review.reviewBody: I couldn't believe how well it fit. At first I thought it would be too small, but it fit like a glove as it should. It was as described and the quality is really nice. I had my first dip in our lake (Lake Michigan) and I was really happy to see a huge difference. Its comfortable and water did not sneak in and I felt fairly dry and definitely warmer while waterskiing. I'm really happy with it!
review.name: Perfect Layer and Fit!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra Alpine Mid GORE-TEX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Sturdy, lightweight, comfortable, beautiful 

Not yet tested in snow yet
review.name: Perfect

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra Alpine Mid GORE-TEX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have taken these on two rocky hikes, and have been amazing so far. Theyre the perfect cross between the X Ultra 4 and quest boot. Theyre not too heavy, not too light, the outsole is thick enough that you wont feel the rocks too much! In other words, it is as if the X ultra 4 and Quest had a baby lol. I did however switch the insoles for better stability and support which I do for all footwear.
review.name: Superb boots!!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra Alpine Mid GORE-TEX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Got these after pulling warranty from the X-ultra forces mid. (Save your money)
This shoe is leaps and bounds above! The fit is amazing. They have that glove like fit. So hard to find a true lace to toe when you wear 14s. 
They are both sturdy and flexable in all the right places. The metal clasps right below the top hooks, lock the laces into place. This lets you tye your laces without the worry of giving slack to your snug fit. This was an excellent suprise that wasnt highlighted on the website when i was shopping. It should be cause it's quite a selling point for me. 
All in all im super pleased with the purchase. My only knock is the lack of other color choices, but im sure they are soon to come. Im going to purchase a second pair in black when they become available.
review.name: Perfect middle ground from shoe to boot

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra Alpine Mid GORE-TEX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are a great option when the terrain/conditions require more than a hiking shoe but not a full stiff boot. First hike was in a foot of new snow and feet stayed dry and warm. Super comfortable and very light.
review.name: A great light boot

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra Alpine Mid GORE-TEX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Only hiked approx 30k in these so far. First impressions are good, they feel light but sturdy with good support. As with all GTX boots in the summer, theyre warm so opt for lightweight socks. Really like the design. I sized up +1 and didnt regret it.
review.name: Lighter than most in the field, robust so far.

name: X Ultra Alpine Mid GORE-TEX Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I ordered the Ash Rose color of this item, only to receive what appears to be bicycle pedals in the mail. After a back and forth with customer service, the item was re-ordered with two-day shipping, and I received a return label to send the incorrect item back. After two days had passed and I was supposed to receive the correct item, I received an email stating that this item was actually out of stock, leading me to believe that it was never in stock to begin with when I first ordered it. So all in all, I had to spend time reaching out to customer service to receive a refund, re-box the wrong item, and make my way to a shipping store to return it, all while not receiving the correct item or any sort of replacement. Replied to the customer service email that originally told me that this was out of stock with this concern, but only received a very generic response. Not a great customer experience overall - wouldn't recommend.
review.name: Wrong Item + Original Out of Stock
comment: Were sorry for the mix-up with your order and the inconvenience it caused. We've reached out via email to help resolve this for you.

review.reviewBody: Didnt know how the overalls would fit so decided to try anyways. They didnt fit so I needed to return via mail since there is no backcountry store in Idaho. They gouge you for return shipping. I dont think thats fair for things out of our control.
review.name: Not so much the overalls

review.reviewBody: Love, Love the overalls. Perfect fit!!
review.name: Overalls

review.reviewBody: I bought these overalls for working outside and doing yard work. I was tired of ruining nice athletic clothes and/or scrounging for old clothes to wear for working outside. I love the color, the quality is great- very durable, and I have yet to over heat in them while in the hot sun.
review.name: Great for yard work!

review.reviewBody:
I bought these for yard work and I have used them a lot. Pretty durable, pretty comfortable, but them more times I wash them to more relaxed the denim gets. 

My hips arent big so I had to take in the waist a tiny bit and they fit well now.
review.name: Classic overalls

review.reviewBody: I was so excited for these, but they do not fit well. I even sized up and they were too small in the but area but loose everywhere else so it bubbled weird on the top and were not flattering or comfortable at all.
review.name: Not what I expected

review.reviewBody: I was super hopeful for these, but unfortunately the other reviews about fit were so right. I am 59 and ordered a size M based on the size chart. There was no way I could sit down in these overalls. The crotch/ seat area was weirdly slim while the waist area was way too wide for me to size up. I have a bigger butt but not a small enough waist for those dimensions to make sense. Ended up giving them to a friend to save the hassle of returning.
review.name: Weirdest fit ever

review.reviewBody: The color of the product is impressive and eye-catching, but unfortunately, the fit is quite uncomfortable and awkward. Moreover, the material feels too thick, making it uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time. I regret not heeding the warnings of other buyers who had similar complaints about the product's fit.
review.name: Horrible fit

review.reviewBody: Im really short and yes I have to roll them up but the body piece fits well. Good thick working material . Ill maybe hem them sometime but overall I like them. Im considering getting more colors. Im 51 and 155 lb pretty athletic build
review.name: Alisa

review.reviewBody: I was on the fence between being enticed by the sale price and the other bad reviews. I am 56 and 125-130 lbs, and ended up ordering the S. Very comfortable and very relaxed, so if youre looking for a slim-fitting, cute overall, this aint it. That being said, I can see how a more full-figure or a long-torso can have issues with wedgies and the fit length in the body. Legs are a little long, but since theyre intended for spring/summer i plan on cutting them into capris. Im glad I bought them.
review.name: Great overalls for the price!

name: Bib Relaxed Straight Overall - Women's

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Moonlite Elite Reclining Camp Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Moonlite Elite Reclining Camp Chair
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Moonlite Elite Reclining Camp Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Lets be honest Im not getting any younger and sometimes camping luxuries become camping necessities. The Nemo Moonlite Elite Reclining Camp chair gives me the best of both worlds thanks to its crazy lightweight but welcome comfort after a long day of hiking. One of my favorite features is the drawcord supports that let me recline or adjust to sit up straight when cooking dinner. As a bonus, the roll-up doubles as a ground sheet if Im on soft surfaces and prevent me from sinking in. There have been some times when I did feel the chair aggravated the underside of my legs when sitting for long periods as  I am a taller person.
review.name: Siterella finally found her Prince Chairing!

review.reviewBody: I work at a certain camping equipment store. Trying it out at work made it a simple decision to relay on the Moonlite Elite as my camping chair!
review.name: Love at First Sit

review.reviewBody: I really like this chair for it's lightweight, small pack size, comfort, and the overall design and execution of the product. It's easy to setup and pack away and barely noticeable when inside or attached to a backpack.
review.name: Ingenious Design

review.reviewBody: This is my third 'lightweight' camp chair and for me (6'2" 185 lbs) it is almost perfect. Utilizing the bottom platform as both a storage sack and platform to keep the feet stable of soft ground is near genius. My only nit would be the width and back height of the chair. Being tall, I find the back just a tad short. And surprisingly, my thinner frame would prefer an inch or two wider seat. But otherwise, this was a welcome upgrade.
review.name: A very good update to a comfy camp

review.reviewBody: I agonized for awhile on what chair to buy for backpacking. I go with my wife and our two little kids mostly into the Sierra mountains and love to just sit by waterfalls while the kids play for hours. Sitting on the ground or rocks that long hurts! So I finally decided on the Moonlite Elite and could not be happier. It is SUPER lite. At basically a pound, I could not tell that I added it to my pack honestly. I used it multiple times on the last trip to Glen Aulin and the grand canyon of the Tuolumne in Yosemite National Park. I highly recommend this chair.
review.name: Super lite chair

review.reviewBody: Wonderful for backpacking! It the best chair on the market. Extremely light weight and comfortable while at the same time durable. Would recommend this product to everyone
review.name: Amazing chair

review.reviewBody: Ive cycled through a number of ultralight chairs and this one is the best Ive found. Its lightweight, compact, comfortable, and with the genius carrying case that doubles as a base for soft ground Ill take it anywhere. Small and versatile enough to take backpacking, hiking, hunting or to a picnic or concert, I pretty much leave this in the car so its always handy.
review.name: Checks all the boxes!

review.reviewBody: Chair is super-light, and very comfortable, easy to assemble and fit into your pack.  My only knock on it is when leaning back, the corners can sometimes poke your shoulders.
review.name: Great for Backpacking

review.reviewBody: Bought this to replace my backpacking chair after it broke. Wow what an upgrade! Almost a pound saved, can great recline or sit upright with quick adjustment (rather than just slouching) and it sets up/down super easy. I've tried a lot of light weight sitting set ups and this is by far my favorite.
review.name: Wonderful chair, wonderfully light

review.reviewBody: Super nice to have when you have no worries and your out for a quick trip. Better than the ground. Lighter than the majority of other options.
review.name: Great piece of gear for leisure packing

name: Moonlite Elite Reclining Camp Chair

review.reviewBody:
I bought this jacket with the intention of using it as an insulation layer while Backcountry splitboarding, standing at belays, and to any other endeavor where an insulation piece is needed in case weather turns sour or I need to be stationary for a while in the cold. 

I chose this jacket because Black Crows has is a company with awesome style and, while function is the priority, why not look dope while being functional? This puffy seemed like it would achieve both my goals of form and function.

However, immediately out of the package before even trying it on, the stitching in-between the baffles was already coming severely undone in multiple locations. To the point where if they were to be snagged it would cause legitimate tears. Additionally, the embroidered logo was partly unraveled and with a slight pull would continue to do so. 

Down jackets are already inherently fragile by design, and I would not trust this jacket to hold up around town, let alone the backcountry or alpine conditions. Additionally, I reached out to Black Crows' warranty department & they have yet to get back to me in over a weeks time despite being thorough. Part of this is probably because they're based out of France on the other side of the world from me in Idaho. Because of the quality issues & lack of customer support, I chose to return this product. It's a piece with incredible style, but less than stellar quality control, all while commanding a price $100 USD higher than arc'teryx' Cerium down jackets. 

My hope is that in the future Black Crows fixes their construction quality issues and achieves bomb-proof construction on par with their incredible aesthetics.
review.name: Perfect style, questionable construction

name: Ora Micro Down Jacket - Men's

I love it!  I wear it when I'm walking sometimes, it's loose enough in the shoulders to be comfortable as my arms move.

review.reviewBody: But havent tried in bitter cold winter weather (20s-30s).  Very comfortable. Fits well, looks great.

review.reviewBody: I am normally a small/Medium or a 6. I ordered the M (8-10) and I can barely zip it up, and its short on my torso. It fits like a tight 4. Otherwise it would have been great for winter riding. Very insulated and functional pockets.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the overall look and how the lid secures with the strap.I also really enjoy that unlike other Bento boxes it has an adjustable divider that I can move according to what Im putting in there. I enjoy bringing this to work and it brightens my mood during the day!
review.name: Beautiful and practical

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have searched, for SO LONG, for a lunchbox that fits my needs. And I found it! This one has an insert that allows me to put my fresh veg on top of whatever is in the bottom, so it doesn't end up a soggy mess. And, it is large enough to even have a couple of different meal options in here. Well worth the price!
review.name: I LOVE THIS!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good size, can fit everything from salad, sandwiches, fruits. I am using it daily!
review.name: My bento

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Thats my favorite lunch box ever. It brightens my every meal. I love the divider, so you can add your protein later (especially when its still hot), so your salad wouldnt get soggy. I put utensils and some crackers on the top divider. And my lunch is ready
review.name: Stylish perfection

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A feature I really love is that this product stacks neatly without waisted space! Another plus is that you dont lose track of items ... that means less waste! One box can store a number of leftovers, fruits and/or vegetables. The Bento Box is an excellent solution for keeping your fridge , pantry or freezer orderly and neat.
review.name: A Solution For A Clean Neat Fridge!

review.reviewBody: I love the size & the way it lock - not sure yes if it doesn't spill any sauce.
review.name: A Must

review.reviewBody: I really loved this box at first. Its a great size for a salad and extra snack on top. Unfortunately the strap ripped pretty quickly making it unusable.
review.name: Great design, but strap broke quickly

review.reviewBody: - Spacious - Functional- modern yet functional - loved the divider and extra compartment on the top that can be use as extra plate for sharing- Made to last with ergonomics in mind when designing this lunchwear.
review.name: Modern Lunch bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it, but/and it is really big. If they made one 2/3 this size, it would be perfect, but a great product.
review.name: Love it but/and really big

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this for meal prep lunches. Love the different compartments and it looks super cute! I can fit a lot of food in here.
review.name: Bought this for meal prep

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Comfort Light SI Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The pad and condition are fine but I wanted a thicker pad. This one only inflated 1 inch and I was hoping for more. I'll try a different one.
review.name: Not what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Purchased backpacking inflatable mattress pad several years ago and has always leaked air slowly overnight. I was never able to find source of leak. Sea to Summit exchanged the pad for new after I described the issue and provided photos. New pad works great!
review.name: Defective Air Mattress

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleep mat is very comfortable. It kept me from getting very cold during a 31 F. overnight, and I am really not much of a camper! I was grateful to have the sleep mat with me.
review.name: Sleep pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great warranty, Sea to Summit sent me a new sleeping pad after my original pad had a defect that occurred years after purchasing it. The sleeping pad is light and perfect for backpacking trips.
review.name: Awesome Company!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am a huge fan of S-to-S products. I own dozens of their bags, pads, liners, towels, etc. This sleep pad excels in two areas. First, it packs down pretty small for a SI mat. Second, it is comfortable once fully inflated. The downside is that the self-inflating function is not great. I leave the mat inflated while stored in hopes of not damaging the core. Unfortunately, it still does not inflate well on its own, even after being packed for just a short time. I do not believe this is a unique problem to this brand or model, more of an universal limitation. I highly recommend using a S-to-S bellows stuff sack to assist in filling up the mattress. S-to-S should consider making all their mattress stuff sacks the bellows version. I have two and they are awesome.
review.name: I am a huge fan

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Packs up small for a self inflating mattress. It's comfortable and keeps me warm so far. I like self inflating mattresses because it's a bit of insurance against leaks. You can at least have some cushion if it fails. It does seem slightly thinner than other mattresses I own of the same claimed thickness but I haven't actually measured it.
review.name: Good balance of size and performance

review.reviewBody: On my third year using the pad, which was an upgrade for me primarily to avoid having to inflate an old REI sleeping mat, but turned out to be very helpful when I bought an ultralight backpack - it serves as the internal support system very well. It is comfortable enough, more so than the REI pad, and once I got the hang of deflating it for packing, is a pretty great piece of equipment. Also not very noisy, which is a plus.
review.name: Good trade off between weight, functionality, comfort

review.reviewBody: After I inflated it with my lungs, the foam inside started tearing apart, creating a "pillow" growing over time. And this was before I even tried to lay on it. Hopefully, I can get the money back.
review.name: The foam tore apart in the first use!

review.reviewBody: This sleeping pad ROCKS! Perfect setup for car camping and felt like i was sleeping in a real bed! Gave me awesome rest the night before a big gravel race. 10/10 recommend! #BackcountryGearhead
review.name: SLEPT SO GOOD

review.reviewBody: I've been hiking the Appalachian trail and I couldn't be happier with this Mat. I'm a side sleeper and this has been a dream to sleep on . Not to mention Nate in customer service was a huge help in getting my mat replaced.
review.name: Comphort light S.I

review.reviewBody: Excellent backpack. Is the second one I have from North Face and they are getting better. Ideal for every day use if you don't use it to carry a laptop. This one doesn't have a Laptop compartment but the une I had before I did and it worked great.
review.name: Backpack

review.reviewBody: Great pack. Bombproof construction and well designed for hybrid organizing stuff and just being a simple straightforward daypack.
review.name: Yup, would def buy again.

review.reviewBody: Great2 its big, plenty of room for school books, laptops. Like the various pockets for organization and easy access. Recommend this for other students.
review.name: I would buy this again for sure.

review.reviewBody: Love this backpack!! It holds so much!! The color is great because it hides dirt and is low key but not black or grey like everyone usually gets. Love it!!
review.name: Love this backpack!!

review.reviewBody: The compartments dig into each other a bit and the waist straps are extremely hard to remove. Overall though, the rest of the features are good.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Great every day backpack, like the color because car or vehicle can see you far away. Use it every day to work
review.name: Highly recommended

review.reviewBody: It's exactly what I'm looking for- spacious, sturdy, and I love the look. The straps on the bottom and the sides allow for adjusting how much space the bag uses. Im
review.name: Very happy with this purchase!

review.reviewBody: I use this every day for work. Everything about it is great. The should pads and chest strap are very adjustable making it fit exactly how you want. Zippers are solid. The water bottle pockets are deep, flexible and can fit most any size. I'd highly recommend this pack for an every day use.
review.name: Everyday pack.

review.reviewBody: Great backpack. Plenty of room, lots of pockets, comfortable and cool looking. I like that it has some outer pockets for extra gear but doesn't add to profile or bulk. Very happy with this pack as I'm pretty picky.
review.name: Great backpack - highly recommend

review.reviewBody: Use it for work, fits a laptop, notebook, power cords, accessories perfectly.
review.name: I love this backpack

review.reviewBody: Nice Green color. Warm but not bulky. Well made as you expect from Patagonia. Got a large. Roomy for a sweater. 59 145lbs.
review.name: Beautiful coat worth the price

review.reviewBody: I owned a down sweater from ears ago, but needed one size up for a little more room.   This redesigned jacket is not really designed for women.   It appears to be big in the shoulders, about 2 too long in sleeve length, and very slim in the hip area.   Im 53 125lbs and bought a medium.  The jury is still out about keeping this new design model.   I guess Id prefer a bit more room at the bottom of the zipper .   Im not hippy and I dont have big shoulders, but it seems the design is off for women.   Its roomy up top, but slim fit at the bottom of the zipper.  Im not built like a weight lifter with no hips.
review.name: Light weight jacket

review.reviewBody:
i am super disappointed! i waited YEARS for a purple colour to come out and had always wanted one of these.

i am squarely a size M on tops, 34-36 C cup, between a 10-12 pants size. 54, curvy/muscular and proportioned like the average female.

I ordered a L knowing Patagonia runs small and i wanted to layer it. 

the bottom is super narrow on the hips, and the sleeves taper drastically from huge in the shoulders to narrow at the forearms and wrists. 
the chest is enormous and balloons out comically in the front, while i have to hike it up to zip it, then yank it down tight over my hips.

poor design. do not recommend!
flimsy/thin material that loses feathers.
it is like this was designed exclusively for tall, narrow hipped, huge chested super models. 
or it was designed for men.

Patagonia is overrated, over priced and they really ought to get some size consistency across their designs.
this runs both small and large at the same time!

i wore this maybe 5 times all winter.
total bummer.
review.name: weird proportions, unflattering fit

review.reviewBody: She had previously had the Patagonia Nano Puff jacket & was getting cold in Raleigh, NC, so got her the Patagonia Down Sweater & was so much warmer.  I have had the Patagonia Ultra-Light Down Jacket for 10+ years & it is still going strong.  Wish they would bring that one back.  Patagonia Down jackets are definitely the way to go.
review.name: Got this for my wife & she loves it!

review.reviewBody: I have this jacket in black and LOVE it!  I wear it nonstop all winter so I ordered another one in Navy as a backup. My black one is a medium but its snug if Im wearing a bulky sweater so I ordered the navy in large and its perfect for bulkier winter clothing.
review.name: Love So Much - Purchased Another One

review.reviewBody: Just too tight around the arms, shoulders. Don't really understand why the sizing would change.
review.name: XS fits tighter than my old down sweater

review.reviewBody: Bought this for an upcoming trip. Love the jacket and how light it is. It will be perfect for my trip. Definitely runs small.  Am awaiting the M size.
review.name: Light as a Feather!

review.reviewBody: I haven't worn this in the cold yet but I love the warm feel just putting it on, very soft. I ordered a small, which is the size of my Nano Puff jacket but this runs a bit smaller. The small fit but was too tight when I put a vest under it so I ordered a medium, which isn't quite as stylish on me (it's a bit bigger) but will be more practical as I can layer more under it. I'd say this product is sized like the Patagonia jacket, which I have in a medium. This is less bulky than the jacket.
review.name: nice jacket - soft and comfy

review.reviewBody: Love the "dusky brown" color which is the light purple you see on the site. I'm usually between a small and a medium in tops and I got the Medium so I could wear sweaters underneath, which is a great fit! Love this jacket, lightweight and perfect for New England winters.
review.name: Great jacket, love the color!

review.reviewBody: I have been living in this since I got it, great layering piece for the pow, and stylish jacket for a night out. Plenty of pockets on the inside, two on the outside, and is easy to pack down. I make sure to hang it up as soon as I get home to keep the insulation in pristine condition. #BackcountryGearhead
review.name: Cannot live without it

review.reviewBody: Not *too* small where it struggles to hold the essentials. Not *too* big where it's cumbersome or an abyss for your belongings. Honestly, it's perfect for keeping everything I would otherwise have in my pockets elsewhere. Phone, keys, wallet, headphones, pocket knife, spare change, receipts, and the odd pack of gum or pair of sunglasses. Nothing goes missing. Just right. Usually gravity keeps it at my waist under my arm but I like to hold the strap and slip it around on to the small of my back while I walk. Otherwise it kinda gets in the way of my swinging arm in stride. About as good as a pack can get for the money.
review.name: Just right. Goldilocks would be thrilled.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this, I just wish this strap was a little thicker.
