review.reviewBody: The strap is too short to be considered "cross-body".  Worn that way -- with the strap fully extended -- the pack can only rest against your chest or close to your armpit, not your waist or hip.

review.reviewBody: the item description is wrong - the depth of the bag is maybe 2 max, which in my opinion is actually okay. this bag holds all the essentials, and the two inside pockets are very helpful keeping things organized. the bag itself seems very sturdy.

review.reviewBody: This is a really comfy shoe. However, it didn't work for me. I took a chance on this shoe knowing it was more ideal for someone with a wider foot. Mine are pretty narrow but I wanted so badly for this to work because I really wanted a more relaxed Gym shoe. Unfortunately, the heel was way too large for me to make it work. However, if your foot is on the wider end of the spectrum and you want a comfy gym shoe this is worth a try! I hope they make a version that will work better for narrow feet.
review.name: Will work great for someone

review.reviewBody: Well made, nice looking, and touch screen friendly.  Not for freezing temps and one index finger feels tight.
review.name: Warmer than no gloves

review.reviewBody: These gloves are so warm and comfortable! wish I had bought them sooner since I have poor circulation in my hands.
review.name: Great gloves

review.reviewBody: Ive used the purple gloves twice and they are incredibly warm. I have also used liners underneath but then they become too thick for comfortable driving. I need to try driving in the gloves without the liners.
review.name: Warm

review.reviewBody: I love these! More colors would be helpful to keep from losing them.  I have three right hand gloves and ordering my fourth pair! Anyone lose their right hand gloves?
review.name: Love them and lose them

review.reviewBody: Gloves are fine, they're a mid-warmth. But the little loops ripped out immediately
review.name: Good mid-warmth glove

review.reviewBody: I hoped they'd be thinner material and more flexible and closer fitting to my hands. I wanted gloves that were warm and made it easy to pick up dog poop and fish a treat out of the bag. The fingers are not a close enough fit to be able to do it.
review.name: Good Gloves and warm

review.reviewBody: Love these gloves! They keep my hands warm and I don't need to remove them to use my phone or use the screen in my car!
review.name: I would buy this product Again!

review.reviewBody:
I bought these at the end of the season, so haven't had a chance to see how warm they will be.  They were recommended by a Nordic ski instructor, so I have high hopes!
They run small - I am 5'6", 130lbs and needed a large.
review.name: Seem Warm, Run Small

review.reviewBody: These gloves look and feel great. However I learned the hard way that they were no match for the biting wind during a snowshoe hike at Rocky Mountain National Park. Will wear them when the temps go up a bit.
review.name: Feel great but no match for RMNP

review.reviewBody: Great purchase for weekends ski trip to Itah powder then they will be on to college next Fall in Michigan
review.name: Great for all outdoor endeavors

review.reviewBody: Great shoes but at first I was not sure.  I ordered them over the net and did not realize they were suede and suede is great but as my dailies I tend to be hard on my shoes.   First day dropped mustard sauce on them (cried inside) and they were stained up good; third day stepped into some mud soaked grass while walking and I thought for sure they would be stained up forever etc.  I ran them through the washer once and cleaned them another time and now they are great.  These shoes have great soles, great quality shoe laces, i could see getting those elastic shoes laces you don't tie up with these shoes, similar to ON shoes.  Zero drop, and you can feel the ground well but thick enough to give you some protection.  I typically wear high end barefoot shoes and they are fantastic, but I feel these shoes are right there with them in terms of quality and comfort.  This is my second set of Merrell of shoes and I loved the soles on them, so was hopeful I would get the same experience as the last pair.  And so far I am loving these shoes...
review.name: Excellent barefoot shoe

review.reviewBody: GREAT SHOE. Ive had them for 3 months, and they have held up really well. Love the fit and look. Will get another pair because Im afraid that when my current pair finally needs to be replaced, Merrell might not be making these. Its happened to me before with another brand.

I bought these because of how much I love the Trail Glove 7 and wanted to see the difference. They felt more like a sneaker compared to the Trail Glove 7 which was not a bad thing at all. I would say these are one step below a sneaker, but one step above the Trail Glove Barefoot which is a great in-between especially for someone who may want to try barefoot but never has. These are a great place to start!
review.name: Love the shoes!
comment: Thank you for sharing your review with us!

review.reviewBody: The shoe was very comfortable, I used it on a trip to Europe. I really liked it because of its simplicity and really no need for a break in period. I am looking to purchase another one but in a different color.
review.name: Wrapt fit like a glove

review.reviewBody: Just bought these shoes and I cannot wear them because they are very poorly constructed. The left shoe is larger than the right shoe and wider, one shoe doesn't have enough material so that there is a gap when tying it, one shoe has a higher back and more rubber than the other, basically completely uneven construction and unwearable
review.name: Buyer beware

review.reviewBody: It's quality I would expect from Merrell! The shoe/sneaker has good quality material and fits like a glove on my feet!!!
review.name: A sneaker/shoe you'll enjoy!

review.reviewBody: Nice shoe with good fit for my wide feet especially with a bunion issue. Stylish as well.
review.name: Good for wide feet

review.reviewBody: Un soulier extrmement confortable et convient tellement  la marche urbaine.
review.name: Je recommande

review.reviewBody: No heel support.  Very flat.  Best for a home slipper
review.name: Avoid

review.reviewBody: I love the wide toe box!  My feet really need a shoe like this and it is perfect.
review.name: Perfect
comment: We love to hear that! Thanks Jerry!

review.reviewBody: One of the best styles I owned. I have not even tried it on yet.
review.name: Kutsu

review.reviewBody: These are amazing all purpose athletic shoes which I bought for CrossFit workouts. The soles are super grippy which provides perfect traction for box jumps. The neutral shape is great for deadlifts and squats. The textured laces are easy to tie. Very comfortable and lightweight. An all around great choice.
review.name: Fantastic Cross Training Shoes

review.reviewBody: Absolutely no arvh support, I had hopes for this shoe, because it resembled the Adidas Running shoes
review.name: Pass

review.reviewBody: I can understand how people can give a bad review based upon expectations from a previous model.  For me, these are near perfect. I'm not a barefoot guy, have tried in the past and ended up injured.  These have just enough cushion and support for me that I can do a very rigorous hike and my feet felt fine.  I did a really steep and rocky hike in these in SoCal and they performed well.  I was hoping I would not have an issue.  I love these and they've become my favorite shoe.  I actually have a first generation of these shoes, but I only use them for water shoes while kayaking.  No quality issues to date.  Love the style and contrast of the sole being a different color.  I'm 55, 6'3" and 220 lbs.  Very active, but I don't run at all.
review.name: Between barefoot and structure

review.reviewBody:
I'm going against the trend of big fluffy footing for a reason. My foot fits well in New Balance, I've tried almost all of them over the years from racing to trail running, to gym shoes. I ditched my Hoka Bondi for these beauties and have never been happier. Yes Hoka's have been trending for the last few years and I gave them a shot. 
What I will tell you is my feet feel so in touch with the ground that I wear them everywhere. My heal isn't lifted up and the excessive cushion doesn't distract from what I'm doing.  There is just enough protection for trail running, hiking and gym time. If I were on very rocky trails I'd look for some more sole. 
No marshmallow under my foot, no ungodly colors or distractions, not likely to be the next fad, ample protection, and full fun. 

Highly recommended.
review.name: You know its right out on the trail.

review.reviewBody: It's the best fitting New Balance shoe I've ever owned, but it is not the Minimus of old. The sole is too heavy and almost 2 centimeters longer at 9 1/2 size. It is also wider and thicker. These are my archery shoes and I want to feel the ground through the shoe like I could with the old Minimus. Time will tell if I grow to like them.
review.name: Not the Minimus of Old

review.reviewBody: The all black are great except the toe tip looks like buck teeth or a camels toe. This would have looked much better in black.
review.name: Toe tip looks like buck teeth/camel toe in brown.

review.reviewBody: Yes I like the shoes they are lit weight and good in all train.
review.name: New shoes

review.reviewBody: Nothing like they used to be.  Toe is not shaped to front of the foot. Heel is high.
review.name: Like the old ones. Sorry to see them go away.

review.reviewBody: Great.  Lightweight and comfortable. Met my expectations.
review.name: Great.  Lightweight and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I bought mine last year and love it. I bought one for my wife and she loves it. Were just starting our season in the NW, but I know she will love it as much as I do
Great waders!!  Cant imagine any better fit nor function.
review.name: G3 Waders Rock!!  Great waders!!  Cant imagine any better fit nor function

review.reviewBody: Comfort and fit they are the best waders.
review.name: First time fly fishing

review.reviewBody:
I have patched my old waders in many places and had finally decided it was time to bite the bullet which isnt always easy as a guide because  lets face it .. waders are expensive .. good durable waders are expensive! I was totally stoked to order the womens G3 wader .. they came .. they sat in the box until the high waters finally receded and guiding wading trips was doable. I love the shear durability of these waders ! Everything fits to a t EXCEPT  the chest part with the suspenders is absolutely H U G E !!?? I am 54 and 123lbs .. typically a size 6 .. 
there is absolutely ZERO adjustment to cinch the top tighter to your body?? If I go down its going to be like a huge bucket and fill with water  scary!!! and especially at my size ! What can I do other than wear a huge down puffy (during the summer) to take up all of the huge space in the bib??
review.name: Durable .. BUT  dangerous !!!

review.reviewBody:
The sizing needs serious improvements. Advertised as a women-specific cut, however, the chest area is extremely large even on a small. Ended up comparing, the small to my old Simms waders from 2017 that are size M 8-9, and the chest is over an inch wider now. Not sure of the reason for the change in sizing.

Overall, not what I was looking for as someone who guides in waders every day for four months.
review.name: Poor sizing with extremely large chest area

review.reviewBody: Dispite being the best waders on the market, I need to take away a couple of stars. Here is why. I basically live in my waders for about eigjt months of the year. The size range on women's waders is not sufficient, so I need to always buy men's waders. And then they never fit very well either because men and women are built different. This results in excessive wear and tear on certain parts of the waders, and then I get wet. Sort of defeats the purpose, and I am not super into buing new ones or sending my waders back every year to be repaired. The website does not even have women's waders on the size chart as of today when I looked to see if anything had improved since i sent an email saying what kinds of sizes need to be included. Clearly it has not, even though I got an email back saying I should look forward to these new sizes.  so I guess I am going to have to get poorly fitting waders again. Please fix your tall sizes so that those of us who are actually tall can get something that fits. I am 6'2 with a 38 inch inseam and women's 11 shoes. I am sure those of us who are my height also come in different girth, just like the men do. Please fix this.
review.name: WOMENS WADERS NEED IMPROVEMENT

review.reviewBody: I've flyfished about twenty years and have had many kind of waders from different brands. I bought my simm's G3 Guide Stockingfoot waders two years ago and I have used these during four fishing trip, about 25-30 days. During last fishing trip in NZ the belt loops loosed totally. The waders were sent to European distributor of Simm's product (Flyfishing Europe). They repaired the belt loops but they also tested the waders if there is other problems and they found over over 150 pinholes in my waders! Over 150 pinholes and under 30 fishing days. And I'm not a hard wader and don't walk through thick buses etc. I'm totally disappointed to the quality of these waders, which are most ecpensive what we have in Europe. Sad to say but I can't recommend these waders to anybody who want to have durable and sustainable waders.
review.name: Flyfishingwomanfromfinland

review.reviewBody: I hesitated because of the price but Im so grateful I made the choice to purchase these waders. My last pair were for Women but I didnt like the boxy fit. These fit perfectly and the material is the best from all I have tried. Standing in 55 degree water in the PNW, Im comfortable with just leggings under.  The only downside is I use a bait gel and its doesnt come off the material. Guess it gives it character. Buy these, worth it.
review.name: Fit for a woman, comfortable and breathable

review.reviewBody:
I replaced my old women's guide waders purchased in 2015. Unfortunately I am not that impressed with the newer model. The material of the new waders is thinner and seems less durable. The chest area is much larger and the shoulder strap padding gets tangled easily when taking waders on/off. There is only 1 belt loop in the back, not sure why? When you take your waders off your pliers on your belt instantly fall off. The gravel sleeves that go over the boots are worthless. The chest pocket is made of thin material and I fear I will puncture a hole soon.
Despite my complaints, theyre still keeping me dry after 3 weeks of constant use. 
Overall, I want to love them but my old pair is by far way more functional. 
Im 54, 113 lbs, 34 chest, shoe size 7.5. It all runs true to size other than the chest area.
review.name: They could be better

review.reviewBody: Great product! Arrived quickly and in good shape. Can't say enough good things about their performance.

name: G3 Guide Stockingfoot Wader - Women's

review.reviewBody: Proud to say I have gone through the wringer with Filson products and this flannel is no exception. Medium weight, high-quality stitching, and double chest pockets make this a go-to outdoor working shirt. Sleeves are plenty long enough for a tall guy with a relaxed fit.
review.name: Built to last

review.reviewBody: I have two of these shirts in different colors.  I use it as a work shirt that usually layers over another other clothing for warmth. The size is perfect for me as a top layer.  The tightly woven shirt provides good wind protection as well as durability.  Definitely recommend.
review.name: Top quality working shirt

review.reviewBody: I was worried about this shirt being too large based on the other reviews. I am 6?0 175 lbs and would normally go for an XL for sleeve length. However, most reviews say this shirt runs large. I got the L and right out of the box it seemed big, however, it?s 100% cotton. So I ran it through the washing machine in hot water and then put it through the dryer on high heat and it?s shrunk a bit down to perfect. Go a size down, but not much more than that. I?ll have this shirt the rest of my life.
review.name: High quality

name: Alaskan Guide Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: I was very disappointed how thin the material was for the price they charge. I'm sure for some people these would work, but I returned them because I go to gym multiple times a week and do a lot of classes so I would be afraid they would get a hole in them or show everything in certain light so can't personally recommend these tights.

review.reviewBody: I was nervous as there were a lot of reviews indicating these ran too small.  I wear a14, and that was the largest.  Wear them a little while before you judge their size!  The VERY thick liner compresses all surfaces of your foot and it feels like they are too short at first.  I put the liner on my foot and there was almost 3 cm from where my toe was to the tip of the liner. After wearing the boots for about 30 minutes, it was clear that the fit was fine. I was outside in -14F, and my feet were warm and comfortable for several hours.  These boots are fantastic!
review.name: Toasty, and they fit true to size

review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots looking for the warmest winter boots i could find for winter camping and snowshoeing, etc.  My toes and fingers get cold fairly quickly.  I ended up retuning the boots.  They arrived and they are HUGE.  super clunky.  which would have been ok but the fit was a little weird in my heal.  my heal would just slide up and down in the back of the boot when i tried walking around the house.  if they had better fit in the heal i probably would have kept these as they are monsters and probably great it if you are outside in cold weather without tons of movement.  the reviews say it runs small and to get a size up but the heal space has no support and may be out of proportion.
review.name: clunky but effective for the right use

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for November deer hunting in upstate NY.  Sitting in a tree stand for hours on end, in frigid temps, has to be one of the best tests for a hunting boot.   While these boots are not technically hunting boots, they were recommended to me by some other hunters that I have a lot of respect for and I value their opinions.  After a week in the woods, with conditions down to -5 fahrenheit, I can honestly say that these were  the warmest boots i've ever owned.  My standard boot for upstate NY tree stand hunting is made by Muck and is rated at below -30 fahrenheit.  The difference is not even close.  The Baffin Impact snow boot is far and away superior in warmth.  Not even close.  The only negatives are;  It doesn't come in camo, and the sizes run small so you need to size up one full size.  There's one nice side benefit to this boot that I also really appreciated;  they're super easy to get off.  My Muck hunting boots are a pain in the butt to get off, but the Baffin's slip off like slippers!
review.name: warmest boot i've every owned

name: Impact Snow Boot - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Giordana Strada Gel Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Product quality was as advertised
review.name: Excellent product and price

review.reviewBody: This is a very comfortable glove, fits well, nice padding. The reflective logo/accents washed off with the first wash (in cold water). If the accents are important to you, don't buy this glove if you plan to wash it. The color held, for the first wash, hoping it doesn't fade after subsequent washes. Would buy again, unless the color fades quickly.
review.name: Nice glove, reflective accents wash off

review.reviewBody:
Then look old quick.  Stickers fall off and fading.

Padding is OK but, the inside of the glove gets slimy.  I'm thinking of getting gymnastic chalk to see if that works.

I have, generally speaking, large hands but I get medium in my cycling glove so they're tight.  These do hold up to that strain. 

Not worth list price at all.
review.name: not that good

review.reviewBody:
Bought 3 sets of these in yellow in late summer 2019.  Cushioning is great, they fit well, and fabric and stitching have held up well.  Unfortunately, after just 2 summers of use they're looking sad:
(1) The 3 silver decals on the backs (the bar, the unicorn with a bow, and "Giordana") fall off.  The gloves have been washed only in cold water using "free & clear" detergent and hung dry.
(2) The color has faded from a bright to a faint yellow.
At least they haven't fallen apart and are still comfortable.
review.name: Comfy but won't buy them again

review.reviewBody: These are very well constructed and cushioned which makes riding more enjoyable for this mid-50s cycling crazy.
review.name: Nice and Cushy

name: Strada Gel Glove - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Coalition Snow SOS Ski - 2025 - Women's online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love these skis, and theyve made me a better skier. I feel confident on them no matter where I am on the mountain or what the conditions are, be it ice in Maine, powder in Japan, or bell to bell in Colorado. Theyre float on powder and crush through all the afternoon slush like its nothing. You can pick up some serious speed on these skis, and oh wow is it fun. If I could only ski one ski for the rest of my life, it would be these. Theyre going to show you a good time every day.
review.name: We're BFFs

review.reviewBody: I got on my first pair of SOS skis back in 2017 and haven't looked back! Since then, I've been on 3 different models of the SOS and it is literally the one ski quiver. I use it to ski park, pow, crud, groomers, you name it! I've never loved a ski more, it does great at high speeds, cutting through crud, and floating through pow! At 101mm underfoot it's a great ski for someone looking for the one ski that does it all. I mounted it with the look pivot at the recommended mounting point and think it's the perfect setup!
review.name: One Ski Quiver

name: SOS Ski - 2025 - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got this for my camping quilt and itll hold a whole lot more too, now I have to rethink my packing
review.name: Works great and holds a lot more than I thought

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these sack to keep everything organized in my pack
review.name: Compression sacks

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really happy with my 20 Liter compression sack. I use it for travel packing.
It compressed my clothes with minimal effort and minimal wrinkled garments. Very easy to use and sturdy. I definitely recommend this and my brother-in-law bought two based on my suggestion!
See my 'before' and 'after' pictures!!
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this compression sack it has lasted me a while and I have used this same still for upwards of 2 years and I love it, it is the best combination of lightweight without sacrificing durability along the way.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased one of each of these packs for my daughter and son in law for Christmas because they are frequent travelers who like to contain their luggage to carry ons and a backpack each, especially when traveling internationally. They also go skiing a couple times a year and on that trip they have to pack very bulky jackets, ski pants, sweaters and lots of layers of clothes. They have not traveled with them yet, but they did do an experiment with stuffing one of them and they were amazed at what they were able to pack and how small they were to shrink the sack down to! They can't wait to use them next month for a ski trip. I have now decided to buy one for myself.
review.name: Ultra-Sil Compression Pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used almost daily on our 9 week backpacking trip! Sturdy, easy to use, compressed easily,
review.name: Great compression sack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like so many Sea to Summit products this one delivers on all expectations. Light, water resistant (bordering on waterproof) and well made. Keep up the great work STS!!!
review.name: Another great Sea to Summit purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these for a beach vacay, with the hopes of compressing all my clothes, swim suits, etc to avoid a checked bag. I haven't gone on the trip yet, but I did test how many clothes it could stuff using clothes I had piled up in my hamper. I was very impressed, it could definitely hold more than a weeks outfits. the straps felt very durable. I was using my whole body weight and pulling as tight as I could, and the straps still felt like they weren't gonna budge. I'm very excited to be taking these on my trip, I'm looking forward to not having a huge mess of clothes and being able to comfortably pack other things in my carry on. Looking forward to using these on future trips!
review.name: Really well done!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Literally reduces the size of what I am packing to less than half. Will never go on a trip without this.
review.name: Necessity for packing

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I fly with carry-on luggage only, so being to get everything into my carry-on backpack is critical. These work extremely well for that purpose.I pack only synthetic clothes which dont wrinkle, so crushing my clothes down is no problem.

Be sure to loosen all the straps when you unpack them, otherwise the shape of the tube will be uneven when you pack them next, and you wont be able to pack them as efficiently. I think its helpful to own a few different sizes.
review.name: Will never travel without them.

name: Ultra-Sil 20L Compression Sack
